noun.description: A group of small bones between the main part of the hind limb and the metatarsus in terrestrial vertebrates. The seven bones of the human tarsus form the ankle and upper part of the foot. They are the talus, calcaneus, navicular, and cuboid and the three cuneiform bones.
A thin sheet of fibrous connective tissue which supports the edge of each eyelid.

proper noun.description: An ancient city in southern Turkey, now a market town. It is the birthplace of St. Paul.

origin: Late Middle English: modern Latin, from Greek tarsos flat of the foot, the eyelid.
